SEARCH
Package org.example

Class Calculate

java.lang.Object
org.example.Calculate
public class Calculate extends Object
Calculate class, which calculates the value of an expression. It supports basic arithmetic operations (+, -, *, /) and parentheses to determine operator precedence. The expression is first checked, converted to postfix notation, and then evaluated.

      Constructor to initialize the Calculate object with a mathematical expression.
      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • delSpace

      void delSpace()
      Removes all spaces from the mathematical expression.

    • check

      private boolean check()
      Checks if the expression is valid. This method verifies if the expression contains correct operators, balanced parentheses, and proper use of numbers and symbols.
      Returns:
      true if the expression is valid, false otherwise

    • getOperatorPriority

      private int getOperatorPriority(char operator)
      Returns the operator's priority. Higher priority operators are calculated first.
      Parameters:
      operator - the operator character ('+', '-', '*', '/')
      Returns:
      2 for '*' and '/', 1 for '+' and '-', 0 otherwise

    • toPostfix

      private String toPostfix()
      Converts the mathematical expression from infix to postfix notation.
      Returns:
      the postfix expression as a string

    • evaluatePostfix

      private double evaluatePostfix(String postfixExpr)
      Computes the final result of the mathematical expression. First, it checks the validity of the expression, then converts it to postfix notation, and finally evaluates the result.
      Returns:
      the result of the computation as a string, or an error message if the expression is invalid

    • compute

      public String compute()
      Computes the final result of the mathematical expression. First, it checks the validity of the expression, then converts it to postfix notation, and finally evaluates the result.
      Returns:
      the result of the computation as a string, or an error message if the expression is invalid

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns the string representation of the expression.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      the original expression as a string
